creditline: Gift of the Locksley Shea Gallery Inc. in celebration of the 100th anniversary of the Minneapolis Institute of Arts
description: White neon tubes bent into cursive script, spelling out: with you I want to live; underline beneath script; seven neon tubes
text: Emin’s works are deeply entwined with her personal narrative. It is through her personal experiences that her work explores universal emotions such as love, desire, anger, and pain. With You I Want to Live co-opts an industrial, masculine material generally associated with commercialism, to produces a glowing proclamation—one that is written in the artist’s own script and thus seems surprisingly intimate.
title: With You I Want to Live
